title: could not compile `sha-1` : The current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I was trying to compile [Substrate template](https://github.com/substrate-developer-hub/substrate-node-template) on WSL by running
### Code

```Rust
cargo build --release
```


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`Environment version `:
```
rustc 1.70.0 (90c541806 2023-05-31)
cargo 1.70.0 (ec8a8a0ca 2023-04-25)
```

### Error output

```
Compiling sha-1 v0.9.8
error[E0519]: the current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies: it has the same crate-name `digest` and was compiled with the same `-C metadata` arguments. This will result in symbol conflicts between the two.
 --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/compress.rs:1:5
  |
1 | use digest::consts::U64;
  |     ^^^^^^

error[E0519]: the current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies: it has the same crate-name `digest` and was compiled with the same `-C metadata` arguments. This will result in symbol conflicts between the two.
 --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/compress.rs:2:5
  |
2 | use digest::generic_array::GenericArray;
  |     ^^^^^^

error[E0519]: the current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies: it has the same crate-name `block_buffer` and was compiled with the same `-C metadata` arguments. This will result in symbol conflicts between the two.
  --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/lib.rs:56:5
   |
56 | use block_buffer::BlockBuffer;
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0519]: the current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies: it has the same crate-name `digest` and was compiled with the same `-C metadata` arguments. This will result in symbol conflicts between the two.
  --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/lib.rs:57:5
   |
57 | use digest::consts::{U20, U64};
   |     ^^^^^^

error[E0519]: the current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies: it has the same crate-name `digest` and was compiled with the same `-C metadata` arguments. This will result in symbol conflicts between the two.
  --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/lib.rs:58:9
   |
58 | pub use digest::{self, Digest};
   |         ^^^^^^

error[E0519]: the current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies: it has the same crate-name `digest` and was compiled with the same `-C metadata` arguments. This will result in symbol conflicts between the two.
  --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/lib.rs:59:5
   |
59 | use digest::{BlockInput, FixedOutputDirty, Reset, Update};
   |     ^^^^^^

error[E0519]: the current crate is indistinguishable from one of its dependencies: it has the same crate-name `digest` and was compiled with the same `-C metadata` arguments. This will result in symbol conflicts between the two.
   --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/lib.rs:116:1
    |
116 | digest::impl_write!(Sha1);
    | ^^^^^^

error: cannot determine resolution for the macro `digest::impl_write`
   --> /home/pra_/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/sha-1-0.9.8/src/lib.rs:116:1
    |
116 | digest::impl_write!(Sha1);
    | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: import resolution is stuck, try simplifying macro imports

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0519`.
error: could not compile `sha-1` (lib) due to 8 previous errors
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
```
